resources.string: MockLocation will use wifi to access the Google Maps servers if the network (cell) is unavailable.
MockLocation will use the network (cell) to access the Google Maps servers.
MockLocation uses private local storage on your phone to save recorded routes for playback.

MockLocation is used to set mock locations returned by the GPS provider for testing purposes. This requires ACCESS_MOCK_LOCATION permission. On most phones, this can be turned on or off by selecting Settings/Applications/Development/Allow mock locations.

Privacy Policy

How we use your information

MockLocation does not collect any personal information, like your name, email adress or contacts. If you send us an email with comments or suggestions, we will use your email address only to respond to those comments or suggestions. Your email address will not be sold or distributed.

Permissions

MockLocation uses the network (cell or wifi) in order to access Google Maps servers and therefore requires permission to do so.

MockLocation allows you to record and save routes for playback. The routes are saved to private local storage and requires write and read storage permissions.

MockLocation is used to set mock locations returned by the GPS provider for testing purposes. This requires ACCESS_MOCK_LOCATION permission. This can be turned on or off by selecting Settings/Applications/Development/Allow mock locations.

This policy was last modified on 8/30/2012

MockLocation can be used to set fake GPS locations returned by the GPS provider for testing purposes.

MockLocation is a SocialGoodworking project brought to you by Paul Corriveau. The source code is available at Github.
